required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Screening TO Prevent ColoRectal Cancer (STOP CRC) Among At-Risk Chinese and Korean American Primary Care Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Culturally Adapted Multilevel Decision Support Navigation Trial To Reduce Colorectal Cancer Disparity Among At-Risk Asian American Primary Care Patients

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities (NIMHD)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to conduct a randomized controlled trial to determine the impact of a multi-level culturally-sensitive decision support intervention on colorectal cancer screening adherence among 400 Chinese and Korean American primary care patients.

detailed_description.textblock: This study culturally adapts existing evidence-based decision support navigation intervention and tests its efficacy among 200 Chinese and Korean American men and 200 Chinese and Korean American women aged 50 to 75 eligible for colorectal cancer screening. Participants are recruited from primary care physician clinics. The study is designed to compare colorectal cancer screening outcomes between the decision support navigation intervention and the advanced control. Those randomized to the advanced control group only receives an informational booklet, a stool blood test kit and a reminder by mail. Those randomized to the decision support navigation intervention group receives everything the advanced control group receives as well as decision support and navigation contacts. Investigators in the study develop an individualized screening plan using a theory-based online Decision Counseling Program, share the plan with the participants' primary care physicians, and have primary care physicians to encourage the colorectal cancer screening to participants. Using outcomes data collected by survey and medical record review, this study: (1) determines overall colorectal cancer screening adherence in the culturally adapted decision support navigation intervention vs. the advanced control; (2) measures change in colorectal cancer screening decision stage in the culturally adapted decision support navigation intervention vs. the advanced control; and (3) assesses colorectal cancer screening test-specific (stool blood test vs. colonoscopy) adherence in the culturally adapted decision support navigation intervention vs. the advanced control. Additionally, investigators in the study evaluate intervention reach, effectiveness, adoption, implementation, and maintenance using interview data.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening adherence at 6 months by medical record review
primary_outcome.description: Measure overall colorectal cancer screening adherence at 6 months by medical record review.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening adherence at 6 months by self-report
primary_outcome.description: Measure overall colorectal cancer screening adherence at 6 months by self-report during 6-month survey (by phone).

primary_outcome.measure: Overall colorectal cancer screening adherence at 12 months by medical record review
primary_outcome.description: Measure overall colorectal cancer screening adherence at 12 months by medical record review.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall colorectal cancer screening adherence at 12 months by self-report
primary_outcome.description: Measure overall colorectal cancer screening adherence at 12 months by self-report (by phone interview).

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening decision stage at baseline (Stool Blood Test)
primary_outcome.description: Measure colorectal cancer screening decision stage for stool blood test at baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening decision stage at 6-months (Stool Blood Test)
primary_outcome.description: Measure colorectal cancer screening decision stage for stool blood test at 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in colorectal cancer screening decision stage between baseline and 6 months (Stool Blood Test)
primary_outcome.description: Measure change in colorectal cancer screening decision stage for stool blood test between baseline and 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening decision stage at baseline (Colonoscopy)
primary_outcome.description: Measure colorectal cancer screening decision stage for colonoscopy at baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening decision stage at 6 months (Colonoscopy)
primary_outcome.description: Measure colorectal cancer screening decision stage for colonoscopy at 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in colorectal cancer screening decision stage between baseline and 6 months (Colonoscopy)
primary_outcome.description: Measure change in colorectal cancer screening decision stage for colonoscopy between baseline and 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening test-specific adherence at 6 months (Stool Blood Test)
primary_outcome.description: Measure the fraction of participants who undergo a stool blood test at 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening test-specific adherence at 6 months (Colonoscopy)
primary_outcome.description: Measure the fraction of participants who undergo a colonoscopy at 6 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening test-specific adherence at 12 months (Stool Blood Test)
primary_outcome.description: Measure the fraction of participants who undergo a stool blood test at 12 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Colorectal cancer screening test-specific adherence at 12 months (Colonoscopy)

secondary_outcome.measure: Knowledge about colorectal cancer and colorectal cancer screening (Baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Knowledge about colorectal cancer and colorectal cancer screening (6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Measure knowledge about colorectal cancer and colorectal cancer screening at 6 months.

arm_group.description: The advanced control group receives a set of standard materials regarding colorectal cancer screening.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Culturally Adapted Decision Support Navigation Intervention
arm_group.description: The culturally adapted decision support navigation intervention group receives everything advanced group receives as well as decision support and navigation contacts.

intervention.description: Participants receive linguistically and culturally tailored information booklet on colorectal cancer and colorectal cancer screening, colonoscopy instructions, stool blood test kits and reminder by mail.

Participants in this group receive culturally and linguistically adapted decision counseling from the patient navigator. Patient navigators develop an individualized colorectal cancer screening plan using a theory-based online Decision Counseling Program. After the Program is completed, the navigators develop individualized colorectal cancer screening plan and share the information with participants' primary care physicians. Then, primary care physicians encourage the colorectal cancer screening to participants.
intervention.arm_group_label: Culturally Adapted Decision Support Navigation Intervention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female Chinese and Korean American patients aged 50 to 75, who are not up to date for colorectal cancer screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those with a family history, previous history of removing polyps, inflammatory bowel disease, or diagnosis of colorectal cancer screening.
